bug.short_desc: fix greedy optional dependencies in release repository

long_desc.thetext:
After digging deep in our releng scripts I discovered that one of the scripts uses Tycho 0.12 to generate meta-data as part of the promotion process. Unfortunately that caused all optional dependencies in Mylyn release repositories to be marked as greedy.
More details: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/cross-project-issues-dev/msg08158.html
The build scripts need to be fixed and meta-data needs to be re-generated for release repositories.
The update-metadata.sh script no longer re-generates meta-data. I have also fixed the meta-data for the 3.8.0 and 3.8.1 release.

Steffen, did this issue cause org.eclipse.e4.* packages listed as optional dependencies of soem mylyn UI package pulled in?
As Shawn told me you have found some issue related to my upgrade to Eclipse 3.8 having 4.2 packages.

Yes, this problem caused a number of e4 bundles to be provisioned when installing Mylyn into Eclipse 3.8. I did not see any problems resulting out of that though. The repository is now fixed and the e4 bundles are no longer provisioned.
